body.name: Married to a Wicked Duke: A Historical Regency Romance Novel (Sisters of Convenience Book 2)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Frederick and Veronuca
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful book and characters. Frederick becomes a recluse after his mother died blaming himself thinking he should have dud more for her. He becomes the grumpy Duke who never wanted to marry.By accident Veronica at a house party is directed by her grandmother to rest before dinner to go up the stairs turn left and the first door on the left. She enters the duke bedroom and lays down not knowing that was his room. Both grandmothers nMet it their choice to get them both together. Long story short they marry and Veronica beings out the best in him. hard book to put down when you start reading it. They get their HEA and so much more. Happy reading! Would highly rey.😊

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Breaking down barriers
reviews.reviewText: Through the efforts of Veronica and Frederick’s grandmothers, they are forced to marry to avoid a scandal. Frederick, carries guilt over the passing of his mother, and chooses to not love his wife, and to only conduct a marriage of convenience. Veronica is an effervescent, independent woman who is always a positive thinker, and is sad to learn of Frederick’s choice of marriage. They find they each have a passion for painting, and similar dreams. Frederick spends a lot of his energy trying to remain unfeeling. At times, those were slow spots for me, but overall I enjoyed the story. This author is great at creating an engaging plot, and bringing flawed characters together to not only have a self-awakening, but find their HEA. I loved the grandmother characters, as they brought levity to the story. I remain a great fan of Harriet Caves. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Together by accident
reviews.reviewText: Veronica is having a hard time finding a husband because of her sister’s scandal. Frederick is a Duke and doesn’t want to marry even though all of the young women are pursuing him. Her grandmother takes her to a room and it’s his and she accidentally lies on him! Now they have to marry to prevent to scandal! Do they have a chance together? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars married to a wicked Duke
reviews.reviewText: I loved this story. I look forward to reading more of her books. I recommend everyone to read this story. Katie .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sex scenes unnecessary to genre.
reviews.reviewText: Sex scenes don't add value to plot or character development. This book's great value was the change in male protagonist views and emotional growth.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice romance read
reviews.reviewText: Nice romance read. A bit light on plot and conflict. But over all not to bad a read. I recommend this book to anyone who loves romance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I just finished this book and it was a real page turner. My interest was piqued almost immediately. The plots within plots really made for an awesome story with several plot twists that added depth and moved the story’s complexity further. I enjoyed parts of the story coming together in ways that I hoped they would. Also, the story is perfect in length and doesn’t drag on needlessly. I also appreciated that there were fewer editing mistakes than I can count on two hands. Great Job!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Scandal, a forced marriage and more. I enjoyed this regency romance very much. This is the second installment of the Sisters of Convenience series. As always Harriet Caves writes a wonderful tale that sweeps you away for a few hours. It's a great story.

Frederick is haunted by his tragic past and afraid to love anyone. Veronica family is tainted by scandal. Their grandmother's push them into their own scandal, forcing them to marry. Through their mutual love of the arts, they heal their hearts and have a true marriage.*spoiler/warning suicide is mentioned for anyone with a trigger*

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was the second book in a series of 2 and I enjoyed reading it. I think that author is very good and I have since bought a set of three of her books. This book although in a series of 2 is still stand alone to read, and I would recommend the book and the author.

reviews.reviewTitle: The grumpy duke met his match
reviews.reviewText: Harriet Caves has once again delivered another fabulous read.The story is so captivating that I couldn’t put the book down.The Storyline refreshingly different covering Art. I won’t be a spoiler and give out more details of this book but instead recommend you picking up a copy and reading it . You will not be disappointed 🙂

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 30, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Veronica's older sister had married a Duke under the cloud of a scandal & now her Grandmother & Frederick's Grandmother had conspired to marry their grandchildren by catching them in a compromising situation. Neither of them wanted the marriage but were obliged by the "ton's rules"A distressing marriage at first but eventually they work things out for a HEA
